testCases.title: Walk In Functionality
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality of the Walk In button, including color change and the Activity History interface. It tests the ability to search, filter, and navigate through activities in the Walk In section.
testCases.expectedResult: The Walk In button should change color when clicked, and the Activity History interface should allow users to search, filter, and navigate through activities.

steps.stepDescription: Login to the system with valid credentials.
steps.expectedResult: User should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

steps.stepDescription: Locate and click the green 'Walk In' button at the top of the page.
steps.expectedResult: Button should change color from green to orange and the Walk In interface should open.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the Walk In interface displays the 'Activity History' section.
steps.expectedResult: Activity History should be visible with search field and 'New Activity' button.

steps.stepDescription: Verify navigation controls are present (List, Reports, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: Navigation controls should be displayed at the top right of the Walk In interface.

steps.stepDescription: Test the 'Close' button functionality.
steps.expectedResult: When clicked, the Walk In interface should close and return to the previous screen.

steps.stepDescription: Reopen the Walk In interface by clicking the Walk In button again.
steps.expectedResult: The Walk In interface should reopen.

steps.stepDescription: Test the search functionality in the Activity History section.
steps.expectedResult: Search results should display relevant activities.

steps.stepDescription: Filter Activity History by Reporter Phone.
steps.expectedResult: Activity History should filter to show only activities related to the specified phone number.

steps.stepDescription: Test pagination controls if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Pagination controls should work correctly to navigate between pages of activities.

testCases.title: New Reporter Creation
testCases.description: This test case verifies the process of creating a new reporter in the system. It tests the reporter registration form, validation of required fields, and successful creation of a new reporter record.
testCases.expectedResult: A new reporter should be successfully created and saved in the system, appearing in the Activity History.

steps.stepDescription: Open the Walk In interface by clicking the Walk In button.
steps.expectedResult: Walk In interface should open.

steps.stepDescription: Click on 'New Activity' button.
steps.expectedResult: New Activity dialog should open.

steps.stepDescription: Click on 'New Reporter' button.
steps.expectedResult: New Reporter form should open.

steps.stepDescription: Test the form with empty required fields.
steps.expectedResult: System should prevent form submission and highlight required fields.

steps.stepDescription: Fill in all required fields in the New Reporter form (Name, Age, DOB, Location, Sex, Phone Number, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: All fields should accept input.

steps.stepDescription: Test dropdown fields (Location, Sex, ID Type, Nationality, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: All dropdowns should expand and allow selection.

steps.stepDescription: Test the refugee status radio buttons (Yes/No/Unknown).
steps.expectedResult: Radio buttons should function correctly.

steps.stepDescription: Click 'Create' button.
steps.expectedResult: Reporter should be created successfully and appear in the system.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the newly created reporter appears in the Activity History.
steps.expectedResult: New Reporter Created activity should be visible in Activity History.

testCases.title: Case Creation from Existing Reporter
testCases.description: This test case verifies the process of creating a new case using an existing reporter. It tests the case creation form, required fields validation, and the ability to set department, category, GBV status, narrative, plan, priority, status, and escalation.
testCases.expectedResult: A new case should be successfully created with all entered information and associated with the selected reporter.

steps.stepDescription: Open the Walk In interface by clicking the Walk In button.
steps.expectedResult: Walk In interface should open.

steps.stepDescription: Click on 'New Activity' button.
steps.expectedResult: New Activity dialog should open.

steps.stepDescription: Search and select an existing reporter.
steps.expectedResult: Reporter should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Check the 'Create a New Case' checkbox.
steps.expectedResult: Checkbox should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Click 'New Activity' button.
steps.expectedResult: New Case form should open with the selected reporter information pre-filled.

steps.stepDescription: Verify reporter information is displayed correctly.
steps.expectedResult: Reporter section should show the correct name and phone number.

steps.stepDescription: Select a Department (116 or Labor).
steps.expectedResult: Department radio button should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Select a Case Category from the dropdown.
steps.expectedResult: Category should be selected in the dropdown.

steps.stepDescription: Specify if the case is GBV related.
steps.expectedResult: Appropriate radio button should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Fill in the Case Narrative text area.
steps.expectedResult: Text should be entered in the field.

steps.stepDescription: Fill in the Case Plan text area.
steps.expectedResult: Text should be entered in the field.

steps.stepDescription: Test the 'Reporter is also a Client' checkbox.
steps.expectedResult: Checkbox should toggle on/off.

steps.stepDescription: Set Priority from the dropdown.
steps.expectedResult: Priority should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Set Status from the dropdown.
steps.expectedResult: Status should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Set Escalated To if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Escalation target should be selected.

steps.stepDescription: Click 'Create' button.
steps.expectedResult: Case should be created successfully and a confirmation should appear.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the newly created case appears in the Activity History.
steps.expectedResult: Case Created activity should be visible in Activity History.
